Fields.DialogueText: So, I hear love is in the air.
I think that's a small grease fire.
Nope. Love.
Please don't start.
Yes, the crew is quite convinced that certain other Belles in the fleet have designs on you.
Designs?
Filthy, base, beastly designs.
Arguably the best kind.
So, hypothetically, would you date Bulldog?
It's completely beneath my dignity to comment.
You would!
Seriously, I'm not going to discuss my relationship preferences with you if you...
No. Unacceptable. You should go after Sheffield instead. I'd be much less annoyed, and she's practically a nudist, which could be good for your morale.

Fields.MenuText: She's... look, Sheffield's just warm-blooded, okay?
... Tell me more.
Would you please stop?

Fields.DialogueText: She fights demon ships in her bloomers.
Ha! No, I have every faith that your imagination is lurid enough for the task at hand.
Are you sure? According to the crew, you're assembling the greatest nautical harem the world has ever seen.
Okay. Listen, if I agree to call our plan Operation Tot, can we change the subject?
Our plan is Operation Tot, and you shouldn't need encouragement to use its proper name.
But... seriously, have you heard any more about it? From the admirals? I really think that we can pull it off if they....
Yeah. I think it's going to be authorized.
Much as certain parties would like us to spend more time in the Mediterranean, letting the Morganas clamp down tighter on the Hebrides just doesn't... what are you looking at?
Morganas. Closing in.
Action stations!
@BATTLE
All clear, I think. Well done, everyone.
I'll have damage reports for you in a minute, Captain. I don't think I'm too badly off.
Very glad to hear it.
There's one other piece of news, by the way. It seems we're not done with our friend Joanna.
I don't know why. I assume her thesis paper on you is in by now.
I don't know either, and I worry about putting her in the line of fire. But at least you'll have someone to fleece at the poker table again.
Hm. I do like fleecing people.
Okay, I'm sick and tired of seeing all these Morganas this close to Scapa Flow. Notice is officially served.
Operation Tot should help, once we get the go-ahead.
Actually, I've been asking various outside experts about that name. How would you feel about "Operation Righteous Thunderbolt" instead?
Oh, Captain.
Here it comes.
My poor, sweet, simple-minded Captain.
Uh-huh.
Please stop asking Americans to name things.

Fields.MenuText: Okay. What about "Operation Bring It Home for Bulldog?"
Be nice.
I will neither confirm nor deny any speculation concerning the origin of that idea.

Fields.DialogueText: Or how about "Operation How Far Can One Captain Swim?"
Sorry. Sorry. It was just too easy a shot. I couldn't help myself.
Mm-hm.
Shall we engage the Morganas?
Let's.
@BATTLE
All clear, Captain.
Good job. I need to take a look at some of our supply manifests. Say hello to Miss Sheridan for me when she's aboard, okay?
Will do. And Captain?
Hm?
Joking aside, I really do think Operation Tot will help. It has to.
Losing the Hebrides wasn't our fault, Bel.
*shrugs*
Maybe. But I really need for us to be the ones to clean up the mess.
Captain?
Hmm?
I know the timing isn't ideal, but Joanna's on her way up to see you.

Fields.MenuText: Belfast, the timing is actually closer to "lousy." Visibility is terrible and we're getting hints of Morgana activity right and left.
Is it important?
Fair enough.

Fields.DialogueText: I know. But she's been nervous ever since she got on board. I think it's important.
I think it is to her, at least. I think she's scared.
Thank you.
Miss Sheridan? Good to see you again.
Likewise. And please, call me Joanna.
So... do you have a particularly moving homily for me, or...?
I've been getting letters from a Morgana. Belfast is down in my quarters reading them now, I think.
Letters. Delivered-to-your-door letters?
Yes. With postage, no less.
... You'll forgive me if I require some convincing.
Captain? I've looked them over.
I'm pretty sure they're written in human blood. I have... well, sometimes my senses are too good for my own good.

Fields.MenuText: I'm sorry to hear it. On any number of levels.
Well. Just when I'd thought they had run out of ways to make me want to shoot them.
And what do these letters say, exactly?

Fields.DialogueText: Quite.
Oh, they're very creative about things like that.
Joanna?
When I was here last time, I... well, in a fit of silliness, I threw them a message in a bottle.
Just saying that I was a divinity student, and that I wanted to know if they were demons. I said I had questions for them if they were.
I was... it wasn't serious.
But apparently they collect our refuse. Anything that goes over the side of the ship, if they find it, they try to use it.
Dammit. I want new security procedures in place immediately. Anything that can be burned...
It's not like we've been throwing intelligence overboard.
Think about it. We still don't know what these things can...
Captain, this might not be the best time. Morganas incoming.
Right. Miss Sheridan, I'm going to want to see those letters. I assume the Admiralty already has?
Not exactly.
Wonderful. Get somewhere safe. We'll talk later.
At least you have something to shoot...
@BATTLE
We're clear, Captain.
Good.
So what do they want? What are those letters about?
The Morgana claims to want a meeting.
Really?
It's the one called Treason. If that matters at all.
It really is so much easier when we just see them and sink them.
Okay. I can spare a few seconds.
Thank you.
This is so strange. I'm not imagining it, right?
You're not. The Morganas aren't coordinating to defend. I think we only have to worry about the eastern group. The others are heading further west at speed.

Fields.MenuText: For now.

Fields.DialogueText: For now.
Okay. Let's hit the ones we can reach.
@BATTLE
Well done, everyone.
Belfast?
We really are seeing signs that the Hebrides Morganas just don't care how we engage with the Morganas concentrated off the Norwegian coast. It's not just coincidence.
No, it's Treason setting some kind of trap. I just don't know what we should be trying to avoid.
I still think dumping Joanna in a lifeboat might have some strategic benefit.
No, it wouldn't.
Well, it might make me feel better. I know you're fond of her, but those letters don't make her look particularly good.
But she did come all this way to bring them to us.
Which, again, is why I'm fantasizing about putting her in the lifeboat. I know it was a hard fight, but try to keep up.

Fields.MenuText: You're assuming they're not equally dangerous.

Fields.DialogueText: I'm praying God grants us the wisdom to know the difference.

Fields.MenuText: They're just letting us have this one?

Fields.DialogueText: It's a trap. We've just got to navigate it.
Captain? You wanted to see me?
Yes.
You've read the letters.
Oh, yes. And they certainly seem to suggest that you talked to Treason in person. Did I read that wrong?
Not exactly. You saw that I was supposed to go to certain places at certain times?
Which was very stupid.
Well, honestly, the three of us only met because I talked my way onto a magic warship in the middle of ongoing hostilities because I wanted to talk about angels.
Surprise! I don't have good sense!

Fields.MenuText: Legitimate point.
Let's get back to these meetings.
Well, I guess we all have at least one thing in common.

Fields.DialogueText: There you have it.
Right.
At least we're all in one place.
I was always sent to deserted shorelines after dark. I never saw anyone, or even a ship in the water. I was just supposed to call out, and I think she always heard me.
Written responses would come within four or five days.
I told my godfather, the admiral, that... well, that I'd received information from you that those stretches of the coast might have a Morgana presence.
It's not like I wanted to leave anything undefended. I mean, this was close to home!
But nobody ever spotted anything.
Well, that's something.
Right. I'm pretty sure you're not in any trouble, but you really should have turned this stuff over to someone on land.
They wouldn't have let me come out here. You saw the invitation part, right?
We did.
We're not turning you over to a Morgana. You saw what she did to the dolphins!
But...
It's a trap. And since I don't know what kind of trap, I hesitate to drop you into it.
I was actually thinking I should... I mean, you could give me a bomb or something.
I've thought about it, and if there's something I can do for the war effort, I...
No.
It's a brave idea, but I just don't see it working. Plus, Belfast would probably be really annoyed with me after you were tortured to death.
But if you take me to the place where... I mean, you'll at least know where she'll be, right?
No, we won't, because – again – it's obviously a trap.
It's not as though we're having a hard time finding Morganas anyway, Joanna.
The ones you were looking for?
Yes. We have an intercept course.
Then that's it for now, Miss Sheridan.
I just want to help.
We already have a plan. I can't talk about it, but we call it Operation Tot.
Yeah, I lost a bet.
@BATTLE
Luckily you fight better than you gamble. Joanna, you may want to get below.
Okay, Treason personally dislikes you, right?
But I'm lovely.
Ssh.
Hypothesis -- what she's doing with Joanna is like her attack on Belfast, the city. She's trying to make this personal.
Or she's just using Joanna as a tool because Joanna made it easy.
Oh, I think it's both. But is she smart enough to be using Joanna to distract us from something else? Or is she just making a hamfisted grab for the lady herself?
Captain, you've been awake for... what, thirty-six hours now? Trying to chart Morgana movements between the Faroe Islands and the Hebrides.

Fields.MenuText: That long? Time flies when monster ships are trying to sink you.
Thirty-seven hours and eight minutes. Lost track of the seconds sometime last night.
I'm sure there are crew members who've been up longer. It's just been a rough couple of days.

Fields.DialogueText: It's a famous saying for a reason.
I think you should round up.
So it has.
Anyway, at the risk of sounding pessimistic, I don't think you're in any fit state to guess at Treason's plans now.
Let's just focus on fighting the Morganas in front of us, okay?
Oh, right. I thought there was something I was forgetting.
@BATTLE
No fear, sailors! I have your backs and you have mine.
@BATTLE
Good job, everyone. Belfast, can I have a minute?
Captain? You look... like someone who doesn't want to be told how they look.
Did we get orders we don't like before the battle? You didn't say.
Stage one of the operation has been authorized. In a few days we head for the Faroe Islands, and roll back the Morgana colonies that came from the Hebrides.

Fields.MenuText: And yes, they're calling it Operation Tot.
Air support will be limited, but that's not exactly a surprise.
That's the good news.

Fields.DialogueText: Well. Clearly, they're men of good sense and fine breeding.
We didn't really ask for much, anyway. If we come in when the Morganas are light in the water, we'll be fine.
And the bad?
Bear with me here.
Part of why we're targeting the Faroe Islands is to draw Morgana activity away from Britain and Norway.
What if most of the Morganas don't care, though? What if they're meant to be compartmentalized?
The strategic value of the action may be a whole lot less than we thought when we proposed the op.
Okay, but, counterpoint -
Oh, I know. I'm not saying the islands aren't important.
But, I feel like I'm playing chess and I don't actually know how the knights are supposed to move.
Also, do me a favor and keep an eye on Joanna. I know she's your friend, but I'm still not sure keeping her on board is the smartest call.
She's not a traitor, Captain. I promise.
Never said she was. Just make sure she's safe and accounted for until we know what Treason is up to, okay?
Just a couple of days until we hit Suðuroy. After all this time talking about Operation Tot, it's hard to wait for it to finally begin. Don't you think?
Well, there are other Morganas to sink.
Or we could get back to the subject of which Belles you should court!
Please don't.
Now, if the Italian Belles are an option, Archimede is even more naked than Sheffield. She can probably do better than you, but...

Fields.MenuText: Hey!

Fields.DialogueText: Seriously, have you seen her? Gosh.
"Oh! How do you like my sea shells, Capitano?"
No, seriously, I have to cut you off. You've crossed a line.
That is the worst fake Italian accent I have ever heard.
It wasn't.
It really was. You just sounded like an Ulsterwoman with a bad sinus infection.
Ha! Shut up!
Also, Morganas are almost in range.
"Bad sinus infection." I'll show you a bad sinus infection.
Seriously, work on your trash talk, too.
@BATTLE

Fields.MenuText: I defy her to.

Fields.DialogueText: One wonders if that isn't exactly her style...

Fields.MenuText: Maybe you could learn a thing or two from her.

Fields.DialogueText: Captain! So scandalous. You'd have me flounce around like... like...
Captain?
Miss Sheridan. You should probably get below – we're coming up on some Morgana activity.
Oh, sorry! I was just looking for Belfast. She usually shows up when I start looking for her, but... well, Morganas would explain it.
I think she might actually be praying. Operation Tot is about to kick off and she's...
Heavily invested in it?

Fields.MenuText: That would be a fair assessment.
Alternating between frantic obsession and trying to distract herself by mocking me, actually. She's complicated.
Let's just say that she's a bit stressed now that the moment is here.

Fields.DialogueText: I figured.
At least she has a hobby, right?
That seems fair.
I'm back!
Ready to fight?
Extremely. Then when we're done, we can get Joanna's opinion on your romantic prospects.
Just shoot the damn Morganas, will you?
@BATTLE
Well done, everyone.
Yeah, yeah. Joanna? Thoughts?
I think the Captain should date the dancer Belle.
I don't even...
No, I'll ask. The dancer Belle?
One of the Russian ones. Moskva, I think? I've seen her picture. She looks nice.
HAHAHAHAHAHAHAHAHAHAHAHAHAHAHAHAHAHAHAHAHAHAHA!
Hah... hah...
HAHAHAHAHAHAHAHAHAHAHAHAHAHAHAHAHAHAHAHAHAHAHAHA!
Moskva has a bit of a reputation.
Apparently.
HAHAHAHAHA Oh I think I'm going to pass out HAHAHAHAHAHAHAHAHAHAHA!
Suðuroy ought to be visible at any time, Captain.
Operation Tot is officially go, then. Remember, keep your eyes open for salvage. January Abbott will chew my head off if we don't bring her new toys.
Hm?
You all right?
Just wondering if we should've started with North Uist. Treason will have time to fortify if we start with the periphery of her little empire.

Fields.MenuText: Too late to change our plans now.
We did take that into account when we planned this out, Bel. Relax.
No doubts in front of the crew, Belfast. We can have our panic attacks later.

Fields.DialogueText: I know, I know.
Relaxing is hard. Can Belles get drunk? I've never asked any of the others, but some of the crew make it sound like drinking really helps.
I think your schedule has an opening before morning calisthenics.
It's just hard. When we're following someone else's plan, we do the best we can, but that's where my responsibility ends, yeah?
When the plan is ours...
Welcome to my world, Bel. Command isn't as much fun as it really ought to be.
I'll tell you, though, when this war's over and we can abuse our position without risking countless lives, we're going to get a bathtub full of gin, some fireworks, and an armadillo.
And then we...
Hang on. Submarines incoming.
Here we go!
@BATTLE
Don't ever tell me who.
More incoming.
I see them.
I don't think there are even that many. It's just that there are one or two hiding in every single fjord in these godforsaken rocks.
I don't think "godforsaken" is quite the right...

Fields.MenuText: Stop. Just leave me my simple rhetorical pleasures.
Really? You really want to talk theology now?
Well, I would use filthier language, but you always complain.

Fields.DialogueText: Fine, fine. Go on with your pagan ways.
Not theology. I'm just sure the people who live here love the place dearly.
When you're this tired you just end up repeating the same curse words over and over again. It's boring!
All hands, brace yourselves for the Battle of...
Lambavik, I think.
Lambavik!
@BATTLE
Well, they're not shooting Morganas in the dark.
Hold fast! If the captain's still standing, so should you be!
@BATTLE
All clear. But, nobody relax quite yet.
Captain? Joanna's here to say hello...
Don't take this the wrong way, but you two look terrible. Have you slept at all since Operation Tot started?
I don't need to sleep. The Captain, on the other hand, is on the verge of collapse.

Fields.MenuText: I'm okay.
I've loved coffee for so long, Belfast. I don't understand how it could let me down like this.
I'll sleep when the Faroe Islands are Morgana-free. Can't take more than another few days, right?

Fields.DialogueText: I'm happy you think so.
We ran out two days ago, Captain. I... can't even really guess what you've been drinking instead.
That's certainly the plan. I just hadn't realized how unhealthy it was going to be for you.
Doesn't matter. I'm fine. Let's just win this damn war, okay?
Sounds... sensible.
Ah. Could've been shoe polish in hot water. Would explain the aftertaste.
Djupini Sound.
Well, that's a mess.
The nexus of the Faroe infection. It looks... pretty horrible, doesn't it?

Fields.MenuText: Just imagine all the Morgana parts exploding. I find it helps.
We haven't seen much sign of human life on these islands, either. The Morganas have been busy.
Yes. Yes, it does.

Fields.DialogueText: I'll work on that.
There were evacuations, I think. I hope.
I don't even want to think about what it must be like in the Hebrides.
Right. We can't really hit the main fortifications until the Royal Marines have come in from the south.
So, we keep the Morganas from fortifying further. We can break incoming reinforcements.
Like those over there.
Works for me.
@BATTLE
One outrage at a time, please.
Captain? Any news on the Royal Marines?
They're getting the job done, but when you read the reports and factor in a certain degree of British understatement...
It's bad?
I think so. It also sounds like the Morganas are leaving traps and trying to take prisoners, and that's never good.
What if we attack the Morgana fortifications early? Would that take some pressure off the boys?

Fields.MenuText: Bel, are you suggesting we go off-script? After all the work we put into it? I'm shocked!
That's what I'm thinking.
Maybe. But it would put more pressure on us, and we need to be able to mop up in the end.

Fields.DialogueText: I'm just saying that we should pursue an undocumented contingency operation.
Good. We can handle it.
We will be. I promise.
Okay. Good. I guess that saves me from having to give you the order.
Glad to be helpful, Captain.
@BATTLE
Well, as far as stupid improvisational moves go, that one at least favored the improvisational more than the stupid.
Casualties?
Not on our end, thank God – but there's word from the radio room. Do we have room for wounded?
Most of them are people the Morganas... experimented on. Not Royal Marines, but Faroe Islanders.

Fields.MenuText: Okay. I want them isolated, but make sure they're comfortable.
... Fine. But I want them under guard. This smells like a trap.
I'd rather not risk it. Is there any medical infrastructure left on the islands? Can we check?

Fields.DialogueText: Yes, Captain.
Well, that's a depressing idea. Okay.
Um... when I asked if we had room for wounded, I probably should have made it clear that Command wants the answer to be "yes."
... I may need to use that line sometime.
Wonderful. Make sure they're under guard. I don't want any cuckoos in our nest.
Captain? Belfast? I've been trying to help out in the infirmary, and they...
I know. The Captain doesn't. But this isn't a good time.
I don't like hearing "I know, the Captain doesn't." What's the latest crisis?
There's been some strange activity in the infirmary.
"Strange" as in the doctor's been drinking?
That's not actually strange at all, from what I've seen.
All the Faroe Islanders who were too badly injured to move are awake. And in distress.
And... I'd swear one of them was trying to say my name.

Fields.MenuText: Ugh.
Well, that must have been unsettling.
Duly noted.

Fields.DialogueText: I could be wrong.
You do have a gift for understatement, Captain.
Well... okay, then.
For now, just stay away from them, Miss Sheridan. It's a problem for another time.
Right now, the Morganas seem to be giving up on the Faroe Islands. The Royal Marines are making a push, and resistance seems to be crumbling.
And the Morganas are mobilizing and disassembling their bases – it's all going back into the water.
Which is... good?
Mostly. But it's happening faster than we expected, and it's moving the conflict more toward us.
This probably won't be as bad as some of the fighting back around the Hebrides, but...
You think?
You don't?
They've had a fair amount of time to dig in here, Belfast. Could be a real mess.
So... I'll just go hide, then.
Probably wise. I think they've heard us.
@BATTLE
No, I heard it too.
Belfast? I hear that Joanna's in there with the Faroe Islanders again. Can you hear what they're saying? Right now, I mean.
If I listen. I promise you, they're not conspiring against us or...
Didn't say they were.
Good. Because I was spying on them anyway and would have told you.
Have I ever told you how proud I am of how far you've come since your days as a young, naïve....
Before you finish saying that, Joanna's in on this with me. She's drawing out what information she can, and I'm trying to make sure she stays safe.
Understood. Is there anything I should know?
Apparently, Treason is offering us some kind of deal.

Fields.MenuText: I'm not too surprised. Tot has been going badly for her. She needs to shake us up.
What's she after? Free passage from the Faroe Islands?
Treason told them this?

Fields.DialogueText: Why do you always seem so relaxed when things start going off-plan? That's not normal.
Maybe? They haven't gotten that far yet.
I think Treason is telling them what to say now.
Hold on. We have reports of Morganas incoming.
Right. Get Miss Sheridan away from our other guests. I don't want them to be able to get their hands on her while things are chaotic.
Got it.
@BATTLE
If that thing can communicate with them from distance, I want them even more sealed off than they already are.
Morganas, Captain. Right where Treason told us they'd be.
Takes all the fun out of it, doesn't it?
I wouldn't ordinarily say that attacking a Morgana supply convoy off the coast of Norway was a distraction, but....

Fields.MenuText: But this is a trap.
But that's exactly what it is. It's keeping us from proceeding with Tot.
Don't worry. We just need to hit them fast and get back to the real job at hand.

Fields.DialogueText: To be fair, it's the kind of trap we can shoot our way out of. You usually like those.
Exactly.
Unless she immediately gives us some other low-value target to go running after.
Captain... you know she's angling to keep us from freeing the Hebrides. Or at least to slow us down. If the people in charge fall for this...
One thing at a time, Belfast. Sink what's in front of us.
@BATTLE
Good job, everyone.
Belfast, we're alive. Try not to look so miserable.
So now we report back that Treason seems to be legitimately helping us against her fellow Morganas, and...?
People will start wondering if they should take her seriously when she says she'll help Britain keep India and their Mediterranean assets if she gets to rent out the Hebrides a bit longer.
I have to give her credit. Morganas don't usually hide their craziness this well for more than a few hours at a time.
So... hypothetically, how would you feel about trashing our radios so we can't get new orders and just proceeding with Operation Tot?
No deal. That plan's hardly crazy at all. It's beneath us.
Get thee behind me, Satan...
You know me too well.
Another day, another fight miles away from the Outer Hebrides.

Fields.MenuText: We should probably win it, all the same. As long as we're out here anyway.
Don't worry. We're not going to be playing Treason's game too much longer.
Remember, you only get to sulk for another five minutes. Then it's my turn.

Fields.DialogueText: You still give the best pep talks, Captain.
Oh, tell me this means we have a plan!
I'm not sulking. I'm fuming. There's a profound difference.
One thing at a time. Let's sink these things.
@BATTLE
All clear! Well done, everyone!
Look, Belfast, I don't have a plan, exactly, but I have a thought.
About Tot?
Yeah. And about Treason.
First of all, we agree that she's stalling us, right? We can't prove she's building something in the Hebrides, and she's selling out other Morgana fleets to buy time, but...
But that's what's happening.
Second, I don't think it's a coincidence that she's using Joanna to convey her messages.
You think she's trying to get Joanna's guard down? Or...
Sort of. This is kind of a stretch, but... you know how she went right for Belfast, the city, after you screwed up her plans last time? All that nonsense about "taking it" from you?
I think she wants to mess with Joanna for the same reason. I don't think it's a deep plan, or anything.
I think she's just keeping Joanna close in the hopes that she can ruin her for you somehow. If the best she can do is have Joanna be her mouthpiece, so be it, but...
But?
But Morganas don't have much in the way of self-control. I bet if we let security around Joanna slip, Treason could have one of her Faroe Island puppets take a shot at her...
Wait. Why are you using your "I have a cunning plan" tone of voice for this?
I don't have anything like a cunning plan.
I just think that Treason's big push to lull British command into a false sense of security would collapse if she tried to take out an admiral's God-daughter just because she could.
Oh.
Well... this is awkward.
Make it hurt, people! Those Morganas need to repair just as much as we!
@BATTLE
Well done, everybody. Belfast, if you can...
Captain? She's here.
Good. Hello, Miss Sheridan. Joanna.
You're using my first name? That seems ominous.

Fields.MenuText: No.

Fields.DialogueText: Sort of.
Okay, sort of.
I'm in an awkward position, Joanna. My superiors really want us to get as much information out of Treason as we can, and if – hypothetically – I thought she was delaying us...
There's not much we can officially do beyond registering our concerns.
I see that.
You, on the other hand, are a civilian. As Treason's preferred intermediary, you play an important part in all this, but you have the option of walking away.
If you were to go into the infirmary and tell Treason's puppets that you're not going to be the go-between anymore – that you're leaving the ship when we get closer to British waters...
After letting us know in advance exactly when you were going to do it.
We could hardly stop you.
And we would do everything in our power to protect you afterward.
Um... from what, exactly?
Joanna, I'm pretty sure that Treason's endgame is, was, and will always be to hurt you or kill you, just to make some weird point to Belfast.
And I honestly think our best bet for keeping you safe is to provoke her into acting at a time and place of our choosing.
Unofficially.

Fields.MenuText: I'm afraid it should.

Fields.DialogueText: Captain!
... Sort of.

Fields.MenuText: This isn't an order. Just a thought.

Fields.DialogueText: Sort of.
Well, nobody ever accused me of having sense. At least I'm in good company.
I don't like just standing around outside the infirmary while so much is going on.
Joanna does have guards in there, you know.
Mm.
And outside? Treason's friends are in visual range?
Mm-hm. If this goes bad, we're going to come under fire almost immediately.
That's actually what we want. If she fires first, Operation Tot gets back on track instantaneously.
This is a terrible plan.

Fields.MenuText: Hey, it's half yours.

Fields.DialogueText: True. So I have first-hand knowledge of how incredibly dumb it is.
Yeah, fair enough.
She's about to start...
I can't do this anymore.
Wha... tuh?
You're using me. I've been trying to use you, too, I know. But you're better at it than I am.
I wanted to feel like I was helping, but I'm not. You're just stringing me along.
I'm done. I want you to know that. You've done as much harm through me as you can do.
I'm going home.
Church. Hilllllllll. Can have Burma. Boooooor-ma. Innn-dia. We can give you more.
Eff off, you floozie. I know it's you.
Whoa! Get down, he's - gah! My gun!
Get back! Just... there! Got him.
Yeah, no bullets. I figured you'd take the lazy way there and planned ahead, Treason.
I'll be telling my superiors that you tried to murder an admiral's god-daughter, though.
And then, I expect, we'll be tearing everything you've tried to build to the ground. Thank you for that.
You. YOOOOOOUUUUUUUU!!
Captain, it's starting. Action stations?
It's about time. Gentlemen, tie all these poor people down - we'll finally start trying to fix them after this is over.
@BATTLE

Fields.MenuText: You have a better one?

Fields.DialogueText: Careful what you wish for. I might top myself.

Fields.MenuText: It's not too late to call it off.

Fields.DialogueText: It was too late the minute we brought Joanna into it.
Captain?
Hmm?
Are you in trouble?

Fields.MenuText: Me? I'm fine. You're the one who tried to walk out on her diplomatic duties.
Who cares? I get to fight every Morgana I see again. I'm golden!
I think your godfather suspects I used you as bait.

Fields.DialogueText: Ah.
Any chance that means my poker debts will be forgiven?
Oh, that's just for show. He's never danced a day in his life.
Captain? We're closing in.
I'll be getting below decks, then. But... Operation Tot is back on?
Oh, yes.
Thanks for your part in that. You did good.
It's quite alright. Just win the war now, okay?
@BATTLE
Well done, everyone.
Sort of. We've been neglecting some important business over the last few days.
Have we?
Let's talk about your star-crossed romance with Moskva.
Please stop.
The Captain's joking.
Oh, Miss Sheridan. You make me laugh.
He mentioned something in the last communiqué about throwing me in a bonfire and dancing "like a heathen" as I burned.
One battle at a time, starting with this one.
Our guests are still trying to escape. Presumably to go after you.
Or Joanna.
Maybe. But they seem to be growling your name more than hers. I think you really annoyed Treason with your little speech at the end.

Fields.MenuText: It's a gift I have. I try to use it responsibly.
It's okay, Belfast. You annoyed her too.
Still, make sure Joanna is under guard at all times. This is no time for us to start getting careless.

Fields.DialogueText: I don't know. I think you've been getting somewhat less annoying since all this started.
I certainly like to think so.
Agreed.
As for the Faroe Islanders, I think it's about time we get them to Dr. Abbott. I know you've been trying to keep them calm, but they need more help than we can give.
Any chance we could still use them for disinformation, though? Apparently Treason can be manipulated.
I do like the way you think, but I wouldn't think she's putting much faith in them anymore. I'm more worried she'll find a way to kill them from a distance.
Hang on. Are those Morganas? Off to port?
... Yes. Good eye.
@BATTLE
You take that back.
You look strangely upbeat for a lady under constant attack.
This is better than I ever hoped! Treason is dismantling her operations in Lewis and North Uist all on her own!
Well, yes. So they can attack us in relentless waves.
"And who is he that will harm you, if ye be followers of that which is good? But and if ye suffer for righteousness' sake, happy are ye..."
In a Biblical mood today?
Maybe I just like the nervous look on your face when I throw out the quotes.

Fields.MenuText: I'm not nervous. I don't get nervous.
Just bring on the hellfire and brimstone, okay?
You're such a showoff.

Fields.DialogueText: Heh.
That I can do.
I am not. I'm just trying to share the results of my studies with the less fortunate.
Uh-huh. Morganas incoming.
@BATTLE
1 Peter is all well and good, but I think some Judges might suit these creatures better. "And the haft also went in after the blade..."
Hullo, Captain.
Miss Sheridan. How are things in the infirmary?
God knows. There's a pack of scientists arguing about how your captives can be safely transferred for further study.
I just needed some air.
I get that.
So, how's the war?
We've been doing okay. Got another messy one coming up, though. See them, off to the north?
Is that a lot? It seems like a lot.
Oh, if we'd been looking at that many in one place in September `39, we'd pretty much all be dead now.
Today I like our odds.
To be fair, Belfast tells me you're a crazy person.
She's one to talk.
You know, for all the talk about you running off into the sunset with Belles, I can't help but notice that you and our girl here...

Fields.MenuText: Nah. She's like a sister to me.
It would never work. We'd strangle each other in a week if we couldn't take time outs.
You're the only woman for me, Miss Sheridan. Don't tell me you never suspected.

Fields.DialogueText: Fair enough.
How do you strangle a warship?
Hush, you.
Belfast and I... we are what we are, Miss Sheridan. It's not hot and sweaty, but it's what we need it to be. It's enough.
Well. Okay, then.
Good luck in the fight, Captain.
@BATTLE
Exactly.
We'll make our own.
You look...
Terrible? Exhausted? On the verge of collapse?
Thanks for saving me the trouble of sugar-coating it.
Well, back at you. I'm not the only one who's had some paint scraped off over the last few fights.
Ha. Good of you to notice.
There's been word from the Royal Marines, though. North Uist is Morgana-free. Early signs from Lewis suggest the same.
Operation Tot is a success. Well done, us.
We do still have to fight the remnants of Treason's fleet, even if she's nowhere to be seen. And that thing she was building.

Fields.MenuText: Ah, we'll make it. It would be too embarrassing to make it this far and die just when we've won.
Thanks for reminding me, Sister Killjoy.
Then let's get it over with, shall we?

Fields.DialogueText: You'd die. I'd probably just sink to the bottom of the North Sea and get really bored for centuries to come.
It's what I'm here for.
You do have good ideas every so often.
So... one more big fight, just so we can report Operation Tot was a towering success?
Yes, please.
@BATTLE
And... clear.
It really has been a towering success, you know. Turns out we're actually pretty good at this.
Does it really feel like a win to you? Really? I don't mean that it shouldn't, but Treason could just come back tomorrow.
I thought I'd be ecstatic. But I'm mostly tired.
Trust me. It will sink in.
Anyway, let's talk about your love life. I bet we can find you a lighthouse with a living soul if we really try.
A lighthouse? Really?
What? Light in the dark, protecting you from harm. That's romantic!
It's a building.
You're a boat.
Oh, my God. I don't even...
I'm sorry. Hadn't you noticed?
I knew I chose correctly.
Thank you for that.
